page.title: 07MONKTON ELM NURSERIES.
page.content: There has been a nursery on the site since the early 1900's,growing plants, tomatoes and other salad crops.The garden centre was opened in the Spring of 1982.It was built almost entirely by the staff.Heavy snowfall almost caused the shop structure to collapse. The centre is situated in about seven acres,and employs thirteen people,full and part-time.They sell a wide range of salads including courgettes,french beans,cucumber and outdoor runner beans. All sorts of plants are sold from fruit trees and shrubs to roses and heathers.In the garden shop they sell tools,weedkiller, fertilizer and many other things for the garden.The most popular plants are roses,dwarf conifers,clematis & herbaceous plants. They sell 1000 plants a week.The most expensive plant costs Â£38;the most un- usual is the African Bauqainvillea.
